title: Force app into light mode (theme/colors apply)

requirements.text: Force the app UI to always use light mode (do not follow system theme), so the light theme color tokens in `frontend/src/index.css` are consistently applied and the user does not remain in dark mode.

quotes: the colors did not change; change app to light mode

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the app renders using light theme styles even when the OS/browser is set to dark mode.
No `dark` class is applied to the root theme element (e.g., `html`) during normal app usage.
All screens (loading, logged-out, logged-in) use the same forced light theme behavior (no screen-specific theme differences).

requirements.text: Fix the reported issue where theme/color changes are not applying by ensuring the app’s active theme configuration and global styles do not get overridden by an unintended dark-mode setting or a competing global stylesheet.
acceptanceCriteria: The app’s `bg-background`, `text-foreground`, `bg-card`, and `text-muted-foreground` styles visibly reflect the light theme defined in `frontend/src/index.css` when viewed in the browser.
After the fix, switching the OS theme between light/dark does not change the app’s appearance (it remains in light mode).

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ui` (immutable paths).
Backend must remain single-actor; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Adding a user-facing theme toggle UI.
Redesigning the app layout or changing the existing color palette beyond enforcing light mode and making sure the intended light theme is applied.
